Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

question.title: Given the U.S. maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese steel, will jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four weeks by Aug 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The United States maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese-made steel through August 31, 2024. This means that as of August 31, 2024, the U.S. continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made steel, as verified by official U.S. government sources and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations. Temporary suspensions or waivers that do not permanently alter the 100% rate are not considered a reduction.

Then, is it true that U.S. weekly jobless claims will exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024? For this to be true, the number of weekly initial jobless claims, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, must exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024.

question.title: Given both the U.S. maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese-made steel and U.S. jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four weeks, will a major oil spill occur in the Baltic Sea by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: 
1. The United States maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese-made steel, verifiable through official U.S. government sources and corroborated by reputable news organizations, without reduction or removal of the tariff.
2. U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks, based on official data from the U.S. Department of Labor.

Given these conditions, will there be a confirmed major oil spill in the Baltic Sea by August 31, 2024? A major oil spill is defined as one reported by at least two reputable international news sources, causing significant environmental damage and requiring large-scale cleanup efforts, directly linked to an attack by a regional militant group on a tanker in the Baltic Sea. If no such spill occurs by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by August 2024: (1) The United States maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese-made steel, (2) U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks, and (3) A major oil spill occurs in the Baltic Sea due to a militant attack?
question.body:
(1) The United States maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese-made steel: This condition will be met if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made steel. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, this condition will not be met. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect this condition.

(2) U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks: This condition will be met if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. Only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered for this condition. If this condition is not met within the specified timeframe, it will not be satisfied.

(3) A major oil spill occurs in the Baltic Sea due to a militant attack: This condition will be met if, by August 31, 2024, there is a confirmed major oil spill in the Baltic Sea resulting from any tanker attacked by a regional militant group. A major oil spill is defined as a spill that is reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, AP, BBC, or Al Jazeera) and causes significant environmental damage, requiring large-scale cleanup efforts. The spill must be directly linked to an attack by a regional militant group on a tanker in the Baltic Sea. If no such spill occurs by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Bank of England announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Bank of England and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Conditional on the Bank of England announcing a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024, will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a mental health support requirement by July 2024?

The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If no other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given both a Bank of England interest rate cut and a new U.S. state Medicaid mental health requirement, will a Chinese battery factory begin in Pennsylvania by August 2024?

The commencement of construction should involve significant on-site activities such as groundbreaking, foundation work, or major earthmoving operations. Mere preparatory activities like site clearing or permitting processes do not qualify as construction commencement. If no such construction has begun by the specified date, or if the project is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Panasonic Corporation resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Panasonic Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Panasonic Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Panasonic Corporation and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given Panasonic resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024, will Bloomberg Philanthropies announce a $600 million donation to historically Black pharmacy schools by August 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Panasonic Corporation resolves a major workers' strike by July 31, 2024. This means Panasonic reaches an agreement with unionized workers, ending a significant strike involving at least 1,000 participants, lasting at least one week, confirmed by official statements from both Panasonic and the union, and reported by at least two reputable international news sources. Given this, will Bloomberg Philanthropies announce a $600 million donation to the endowments of historically Black pharmacy schools by August 31, 2024? The announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable news sources or through official statements from Bloomberg Philanthropies or the recipient institutions, and the donation must be specifically intended for the endowments of these pharmacy schools. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the announced amount is less than $600 million, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given both Panasonic resolves a major strike and Bloomberg donates $600 million to Black pharmacy schools, will Missouri modify transgender youth medical care law by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

(a) Panasonic Corporation resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024, specifically involving at least 1,000 workers, lasting at least one week, confirmed by official statements from Panasonic and the union, and reported by at least two reputable international news sources.

(b) Bloomberg Philanthropies announces a $600 million donation to the endowments of historically Black pharmacy schools by August 2024, confirmed by at least two reputable news sources or official statements from Bloomberg or recipient institutions.

Given these conditions, will the state of Missouri enact a new law modifying restrictions on medical care for transgender youth by July 31, 2024? The enactment must be confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by at least two major news outlets, and the new law must specifically address and alter the existing restrictions on medical care for transgender youth in Missouri. If no such law is enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted law does not modify the current restrictions, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Panasonic Corporation resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024, (b) Bloomberg Philanthropies announces a $600 million donation to historically Black pharmacy schools by August 2024, and (c) Missouri enacts a new law modifying restrictions on medical care for transgender youth by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES only if all of the following occur:

(a) Panasonic Corporation resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024: This resolves as YES if Panasonic Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, ending a significant strike by July 31, 2024. Criteria:
1. Involves at least 1,000 workers.

1. Confirmed by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., AP, Reuters) or official statements from Bloomberg or recipient institutions.
2. Specifically for the endowments of these schools.
If no such announcement is made, or the amount is less than $600 million, it resolves as NO. This is about the announcement, not the completion.

(c) Missouri enacts a new law modifying restrictions on medical care for transgender youth by July 2024: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Missouri enacts a new law that modifies or replaces the current restrictions on medical care for transgender youth. The enactment must be confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or local Missouri news stations). The new law must specifically address and alter the existing restrictions on medical care for transgender youth in Missouri. If no such law is enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted law does not modify the current restrictions, the question resolves as NO.

All three conditions (a), (b), and (c) must be met for this question to resolve as YES.

question.title: Will North Carolina hold a referendum on public transportation funding by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, North Carolina officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on public transportation funding. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address public transportation funding, either proposing to increase, decrease, or restructure it. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on public transportation does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given North Carolina holds a referendum on public transportation funding by August 2024, will Boris Johnson remain the Prime Minister of the UK through July 2024?
question.body:

Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, North Carolina officially conducts a statewide public referendum specifically focused on public transportation funding. The topic must directly address public transportation funding, either proposing to increase, decrease, or restructure it. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on public transportation does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue.

Given this, will Boris Johnson remain the Prime Minister of the UK through July 31, 2024? Confirmation of his status must come from official UK government records or credible news reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, AFP). The question resolves as NO if Johnson leaves or is removed from the position at any point before or during July 2024, excluding temporary absences due to illness or vacation.

question.title: Given both a North Carolina public transportation funding referendum by August 2024 and Boris Johnson remains UK Prime Minister through July 2024, will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure increase over 0.5% in a month by July 2024?
question.body:

It must directly address public transportation funding. (b) Boris Johnson continues to hold the position of Prime Minister of the UK through July 31, 2024, confirmed by official UK government records or credible news reports from at least two major news organizations. Temporary absences due to illness or vacation do not count as leaving the position.

Given these conditions, will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) show a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024? The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If no such increase is reported during this period, this resolves as NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) North Carolina holds a referendum on public transportation funding by August 2024, (2) Boris Johnson remains the Prime Minister of the UK through July 2024, and (3) The Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure shows a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?

The referendum must be organized by the state government, and its results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. (3) The Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. The question resolves as NO if any of the conditions is not satisfied.

question.title: Will Brazil's Bovespa index reach or exceed 130,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Brazil's Bovespa index reaches or exceeds 130,000 points. The 130,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or B3 (Brasil Bolsa Balcão). If the index does not reach 130,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 130,000 points.

question.title: Given Brazil's Bovespa index reaches or exceeds 130,000 points by August 2024, will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024, Brazil's Bovespa index reaches or exceeds 130,000 points at any time, including intraday highs, as verified by official index reports from sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or B3. Given this condition, will the UK economy avoid entering a recession by July 31, 2024? A recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth according to the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as YES if the UK does not experience this by the specified date, and NO if it does.

If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question. (2) In any month from October 2023 through July 2024, the United Kingdom records a monthly increase of at least 100,000 jobs in an official jobs report. The data must be confirmed by the Office for National Statistics in their monthly Labour Market Overview. If no such monthly increase is reported within this period, the question resolves as NO. Revisions to previously reported data will not be considered for resolution; only the initial reported figures for each month will be used. (3) The number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 250,000 for three consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered. The question resolves as NO if any of these conditions is not met.

question.title: Will Ohio's fast food industry employment decrease by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, official reports from Ohio government labor statistics or major economic analysis firms indicate a decrease in the total number of employed individuals within the fast food industry in Ohio compared to the most recent data available as of October 1, 2023. The comparison should be made using seasonally adjusted data if available. If employment levels remain the same or increase, or if no reliable data is available for comparison, the question will resolve as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'fast food industry' refers to quick-service restaurants and fast-casual dining establishments.

question.title: Conditional on Ohio's fast food industry employment decreasing by July 2024, will Jens Weidmann remain as President of the Deutsche Bundesbank through July 2024?
question.body:

If he is no longer serving for any reason, including resignation, removal, or end of term, the outcome is not met. Interim or acting President appointments do not count as Weidmann remaining in the position.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if all of the following conditions are met by their respective deadlines: (a) By July 31, 2024, official reports from Ohio government labor statistics or major economic analysis firms indicate a decrease in the total number of employed individuals within the fast food industry in Ohio compared to the most recent data available as of October 1, 2023. The comparison should be made using seasonally adjusted data if available. If employment levels remain the same or increase, or if no reliable data is available for comparison, this condition will not be met. (b) Jens Weidmann is still serving as the President of the Deutsche Bundesbank on July 31, 2024. question.title: Will Mid-Ohio Sports Car Course file a lawsuit against Ohio's top health official by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Mid-Ohio Sports Car Course or its owners officially file a lawsuit against Ohio's top health official (such as the Director of the Department of Health) regarding the raceway's closure during the COVID-19 pandemic. The filing must be confirmed through official court records or statements from the raceway's legal representatives, as reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, local Ohio newspapers, or national news outlets). The lawsuit must specifically relate to allegations of violations by the state health official or administration during the pandemic-related closure. If no such lawsuit is filed by the resolution date, or if a lawsuit is filed but does not meet these criteria, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Given Mid-Ohio Sports Car Course files a lawsuit against Ohio's health official, will Samsung resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, Mid-Ohio Sports Car Course or its owners officially file a lawsuit against Ohio's top health official regarding the raceway's closure during the COVID-19 pandemic. The lawsuit must be confirmed through official court records or statements from the raceway's legal representatives and reported by at least two reputable news sources. The lawsuit must specifically relate to allegations of violations by the state health official during the pandemic-related closure.

Then, is it true that Samsung Electronics will resolve a major workers' strike by July 31, 2024? For this resolution to be considered valid, Samsung must reach an agreement with unionized workers to end a strike involving at least 1,000 workers, lasting at least one week. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Samsung Electronics and the union, and reported by at least two reputable international news sources. If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given both Mid-Ohio lawsuit and Samsung strike resolution, will WHO declare East Asian avian flu no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both (a) Mid-Ohio Sports Car Course files a lawsuit against Ohio's top health official by August 2024, and (b) Samsung Electronics resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024. Then, will the WHO declare the avian influenza outbreak in East Asia no longer a global emergency by August 31, 2024?

Details:
- For condition (a): Mid-Ohio Sports Car Course or its owners must file a lawsuit related to COVID-19 pandemic closures, confirmed by court records or legal representatives, as reported by two reputable news sources.
- For condition (b): Samsung Electronics must resolve a strike involving at least 1,000 workers lasting at least one week, confirmed by statements from Samsung and the union, reported by two reputable news sources.
- For the outcome: The WHO must publicly announce that the East Asian avian influenza outbreak is no longer a global emergency by August 31, 2024, with reports by at least two major international news outlets.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Mid-Ohio Sports Car Course files a lawsuit against Ohio's top health official by August 2024, (2) Samsung Electronics resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024, and (3) WHO declares the avian influenza outbreak in East Asia no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if all of the following events occur:

(1) Mid-Ohio Sports Car Course or its owners officially file a lawsuit against Ohio's top health official by August 31, 2024. The lawsuit must be related to the raceway's closure during the COVID-19 pandemic and must be confirmed through official court records or statements from the raceway's legal representatives, as reported by at least two reputable news sources. The allegations must involve violations by the state health official or administration during the pandemic-related closure.

(2) Samsung Electronics reaches an agreement with unionized workers, ending a significant strike by July 31, 2024. The strike must involve at least 1,000 workers and last for at least one week. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Samsung Electronics and the involved union, and reported by at least two reputable international news sources.

(3) By August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the avian influenza outbreak in East Asia is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:
   - The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the avian influenza outbreak in East Asia is no longer a global emergency.
   - This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
   - The declaration must specifically refer to the East Asian avian influenza outbreak, not a global avian influenza situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if any of these events do not occur by their respective deadlines.

question.title: Will New Jersey conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, New Jersey conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of New Jersey.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Conditional on New Jersey conducting a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, will New York City announce a public transit-only policy for its 2026 FIFA World Cup venues by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, New Jersey conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. This means the referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of New Jersey, with its primary focus on abortion rights protection, and the results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

Given this condition, will New York City announce a public transit-only policy for its 2026 FIFA World Cup venues by August 31, 2024? For this to resolve as YES, the Mayor of New York City or an official representative of the city government must announce a policy through official channels or reported by at least two major news outlets, stating that all venues for the 2026 FIFA World Cup will be accessible only by public transportation, with no significant exceptions to the rule. If no such announcement is made, or if the policy allows for significant exceptions, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given both a New Jersey referendum on abortion rights and a NYC public transit-only policy for 2026 FIFA World Cup venues by August 2024, will North Carolina conduct a tax reform referendum by then?
question.body:

   - The referendum is officially announced and conducted by the state of New Jersey.
   - The primary focus is on abortion rights protection.
   - Results are publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.
   - Merely proposing or planning the referendum without conducting it does not qualify.

2. New York City announces a public transit-only policy for its 2026 FIFA World Cup venues, which includes:
   - An announcement by the Mayor or an official city representative through official channels or reported by at least two major news outlets.
   - The policy explicitly restricts private vehicle access to World Cup venues, promoting public transit.
   - No significant exceptions to the public transit-only rule.

Given these conditions, will North Carolina conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enacting or modifying tax reform policies by August 31, 2024? This requires:
- The referendum to be officially conducted by the state government.
- Results to be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels.
- The direct vote by the electorate must be related to tax reform.
If no such referendum occurs, is completed by the specified date, or is postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by August 2024: (1) New Jersey conducts a referendum on abortion rights, (2) New York City announces a public transit-only policy for 2026 FIFA World Cup venues, and (3) North Carolina conducts a referendum on tax reform?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if all of the following events occur by August 31, 2024:

1. New Jersey conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:
   - The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of New Jersey.
   - The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
   - The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.
   - Merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

2. New York City announces a public transit-only policy for its 2026 FIFA World Cup venues. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:
   - The Mayor of New York City or an official representative of the city government must announce the policy.
   - The announcement must be made through official channels (such as a press conference, official statement, or city government website) or reported by at least two major news outlets.
   - The policy should explicitly state the intention to restrict private vehicle access to World Cup venues, promoting the use of public transit instead.
   - The policy must not allow for any significant exceptions to the public transit-only rule.

3. North Carolina conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting or modifying tax reform policies in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:
   - The referendum must be officially conducted by the state government.
   - The results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels.
   - The referendum must be completed by August 31, 2024, and must not be postponed beyond this date.

If any of these events does not occur by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in Nashville by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Nashville, Tennessee. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a Nashville rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Given Kamala Harris announces her running mate at a rally in Nashville by August 2024, will Minnesota hold a referendum on labor union laws by August 2024?
question.body:

The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources within 24 hours of the rally.

Then, will Minnesota officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on labor union laws by August 31, 2024? The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address labor union laws, either proposing new regulations or modifying existing ones. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on labor unions does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given both Kamala Harris announces her running mate at a Nashville rally and Minnesota holds a referendum on labor union laws by August 2024, will Kentucky's 6-week abortion ban be overturned by July 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, both of the following events occur: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Nashville, Tennessee, with the announcement confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources. (b) Minnesota conducts a statewide public referendum specifically focused on labor union laws, with the results publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. Given these conditions, will Kentucky's law banning most abortions after approximately six weeks of pregnancy be overturned by July 31, 2024? The law must be repealed by the state legislature or invalidated by a court ruling, confirmed by official state announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources, for the question to resolve as YES. If the law remains in effect as of July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Kamala Harris announces her running mate at a rally in Nashville, (b) Minnesota holds a referendum on labor union laws, and (c) Kentucky's 6-week abortion ban is overturned?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if all of the following conditions are met by their respective deadlines: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Nashville, Tennessee, by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a Nashville rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO. (b) Minnesota officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on labor union laws by August 31, 2024. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address labor union laws, either proposing new regulations or modifying existing ones. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on labor unions does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO. (c) Kentucky's law banning most abortions after approximately six weeks of pregnancy is either repealed by the state legislature or invalidated by a court ruling by July 31, 2024. The repeal or invalidation must be confirmed by official state announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources. If the law remains in effect as of July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'overturned' means the law is no longer enforceable in its current form, either through legislative action or judicial decision. If all conditions (a), (b), and (c) are met, this question resolves as YES. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Turkey announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Turkey officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Central Bank of Turkey communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the one-week repo rate, which is the Central Bank of Turkey's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Given the Central Bank of Turkey announces an interest rate cut by August 2024, will the Bank of Japan's interest rate remain at or above 0.50% in August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Central Bank of Turkey officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. This announcement must be confirmed by official Central Bank of Turkey communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the one-week repo rate, which is the Central Bank of Turkey's primary tool for monetary policy.

Confirmation must come from official Bank of Japan announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Nikkei). question.title: Given both a Turkish interest rate cut and stable Japanese rates, will Tesla recall over 720,000 vehicles for autopilot issues by August 2024?
question.body:

- The Central Bank of Turkey must officially announce an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The interest rate in question refers to the one-week repo rate.
- The Bank of Japan's policy interest rate must be reported to be at or above 0.50% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Bank of Japan announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Nikkei).

Resolution criteria for the outcome: 
- Tesla must officially announce and begin the process of recalling more than 720,000 vehicles due to an issue with the autopilot system by August 31, 2024. The recall must be specifically related to autopilot systems that may malfunction and cause safety concerns, as mentioned in the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) report. Confirmation of the recall initiation must come from official Tesla statements or reports by at least two reputable news sources. 
- If Tesla has not announced or begun such a recall by the specified date, or if the number of vehicles affected is 720,000 or fewer, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Turkey announces an interest rate cut, (b) The Bank of Japan's interest rate remains at or above 0.50%, and (c) Tesla initiates a recall of over 720,000 vehicles due to an autopilot issue?

The interest rate in question refers to the one-week repo rate. (b) The Bank of Japan's policy interest rate is reported to be at or above 0.50% at any point during August 2024. The recall must be specifically related to autopilot systems that may malfunction and cause safety concerns, as mentioned in the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) report. Confirmation of the recall initiation must come from official Tesla statements or reports by at least two reputable news sources. If all conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If any condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Facebook's donation cover full tuition for all Yale law students by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, it is officially confirmed that Facebook's donation is being used to cover full tuition for all law students at Yale University, regardless of their family income. The confirmation must come from official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. If the donation does not cover full tuition for all law students by the resolution date, or if it only covers tuition for a subset of students based on income or other criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given Facebook's donation covers full tuition for all Yale law students by July 2024, will the S&P 500 index reach or exceed 4,800 points by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, it is officially confirmed that Facebook's donation is being used to cover full tuition for all law students at Yale University, regardless of their family income. This confirmation must come from official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. Then, will the S&P 500 index reach or exceed 4,800 points by August 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024, the S&P 500 index reaches or exceeds 4,800 points. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the New York Stock Exchange. Intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,800 points. If the index does not reach 4,800 points during this period, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given Facebook's donation covers full tuition for all Yale law students and the S&P 500 index reaches 4,800 points, will Columbia University fully cover tuition for lower-income engineering students by July 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Both (a) Facebook's donation covers full tuition for all Yale law students by July 31, 2024, confirmed by official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources, and (b) the S&P 500 index reaches or exceeds 4,800 points at any point between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024, verified by official index reports from reputable financial market data providers. Then, will Columbia University officially implement a policy to fully cover tuition for engineering students from families earning less than $100,000 annually by July 31, 2024? The confirmation must come from official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources, and the policy must be in effect for the 2024-2025 academic year or earlier.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Facebook's donation covers full tuition for all Yale law students by July 2024, (b) the S&P 500 index reaches or exceeds 4,800 points by August 2024, and (c) Columbia University fully covers tuition for engineering students from lower-income families by July 2024?
question.body:
(a) Facebook's donation covers full tuition for all Yale law students by July 31, 2024. This requires official confirmation that the donation is used to cover full tuition for all law students at Yale University, regardless of family income, from official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. If it only covers tuition for a subset of students, the condition is not met.
(b) The S&P 500 index reaches or exceeds 4,800 points at any point between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the New York Stock Exchange. Intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,800 points.
(c) Columbia University fully covers tuition for engineering students from lower-income families by July 31, 2024. This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Columbia University officially implements a policy to fully cover tuition for engineering students from families earning less than $100,000 annually. The confirmation must come from official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (e.g., The New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Reuters, Associated Press). The policy must be in effect for the 2024-2025 academic year or earlier. If such a policy is not confirmed to be in place by the resolution date, or if the income threshold or coverage details differ significantly from those specified, the question resolves as NO.
The combined question resolves as YES if all conditions (a), (b), and (c) are met.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 30-year mortgage in the US fall below 5.8% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, falls below 5.8% at any point. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. If the rate does not fall below 5.8% by the specified date, or if Freddie Mac discontinues reporting this metric, the question will resolve as NO. For clarity, a rate of exactly 5.8% will not be considered as falling below 5.8%.

question.title: Given the average rate on a 30-year mortgage in the US falls below 5.8% by August 2024, will PepsiCo report increased North American demand for Ruffles by July 2024?

A rate of exactly 5.8% will not be considered as falling below 5.8%. (b) By July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Ruffles brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. (c) By July 31, 2024, TikTok publicly announces a new partnership related to major sports media rights or broadcasting. The partnership must be with a major sports league, organization, or event (such as NFL, MLB, NBA, FIFA World Cup, Olympics, etc.). The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Bloomberg, CNBC). Minor partnerships or those not primarily focused on sports media rights or broadcasting will not qualify. If any of these conditions are not met, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the European Commission announce completion of a major digital privacy investigation by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the European Commission officially announces the completion of its investigation into digital privacy practices involving at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official European Commission announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the European Commission does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Conditional on the European Commission completing a major digital privacy investigation by July 2024, will Ukraine report over 10 fatalities from Russian cyber-attacks in a single month by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the European Commission officially announces the completion of its investigation into digital privacy practices involving at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official European Commission announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times).

Then, will the following occur: By August 31, 2024, official reports confirm that more than 10 fatalities occurred as a direct result of Russian cyber-attacks causing infrastructure failure in Ukraine within any single calendar month. The confirmation must come from Ukrainian government statements or be reported by at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN). For resolution purposes, 'cyber-attacks' refer to attacks targeting critical infrastructure such as power grids, leading to fatalities due to failures caused by these attacks.

question.title: Given both a major EU digital privacy investigation completion and Ukraine cyber-attack fatalities, will the WFP announce over $400M in new funding?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) By July 31, 2024, the European Commission officially announces the completion of its investigation into digital privacy practices involving at least five major companies, confirmed through an official announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets. AND (b) By August 31, 2024, official reports confirm that more than 10 fatalities occurred as a direct result of Russian cyber-attacks causing infrastructure failure in Ukraine within any single calendar month, confirmed by Ukrainian government statements or reported by at least two major international news outlets.

Then, will the following be true: By July 31, 2024, the World Food Programme officially announces new funding commitments totaling over $400 million, confirmed through official WFP channels and reported by at least two reputable news sources, with the commitments being new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs?

question.title: Will all of the following occur by July/August 2024: (a) The European Commission announces the completion of a major digital privacy investigation, (b) Ukraine reports more than 10 fatalities from Russian cyber-attacks causing infrastructure failure in a single month, and (c) The World Food Programme announces new funding commitments totaling over $400 million?
question.body:
(a) The question about the European Commission resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the European Commission officially announces the completion of its investigation into digital privacy practices involving at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official European Commission announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the European Commission does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, the question resolves as NO.

(b) The question about Ukraine resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, official reports confirm that more than 10 fatalities occurred as a direct result of Russian cyber-attacks causing infrastructure failure in Ukraine within any single calendar month. The confirmation must come from Ukrainian government statements or be reported by at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN). For resolution purposes, 'cyber-attacks' refer to attacks targeting critical infrastructure such as power grids, leading to fatalities due to failures caused by these attacks. If no such reports confirm over 10 fatalities in a single month by the resolution date, or if the reported fatalities are spread across multiple months without exceeding 10 in any single month, the question resolves as NO.

(c) The question about the World Food Programme resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the World Food Programme officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official WFP channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will a Texas woman's lawsuit against state authorities over an abortion-related arrest reach a settlement by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a publicly confirmed settlement is reached in the lawsuit filed by a Texas woman against state authorities following her arrest and murder charge related to a self-managed abortion. The settlement must be officially announced by the involved parties or reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). If no such settlement is confirmed by the specified date, or if the case is dismissed or proceeds to trial without a settlement, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given a Texas woman's lawsuit against state authorities over an abortion-related arrest reaches a settlement by July 2024, will the FTC's rule banning noncompete agreements be reinstated by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, a publicly confirmed settlement is reached in the lawsuit filed by a Texas woman against state authorities following her arrest and murder charge related to a self-managed abortion. The settlement must be officially announced by the involved parties or reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post).

Then, is it true that by August 31, 2024, the Federal Trade Commission's rule banning noncompete agreements, which was blocked by a federal judge in Texas, is reinstated through legal or administrative means? Reinstatement must be confirmed through official announcements by the FTC, court rulings, or other authoritative legal sources, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). The reinstatement must be effective and not merely proposed or pending. If the rule is not reinstated and in effect by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO. Partial reinstatements or modifications to the original rule that still substantially ban noncompete agreements would qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Given both a Texas woman's abortion-related lawsuit reaches a settlement and the FTC's noncompete rule is reinstated, will Tennessee hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) By July 31, 2024, a publicly confirmed settlement is reached in the lawsuit filed by a Texas woman against state authorities following her arrest and murder charge related to a self-managed abortion. The settlement must be officially announced by the involved parties or reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). If no such settlement is confirmed by the specified date, or if the case is dismissed or proceeds to trial without a settlement, this part resolves as NO. (b) By August 31, 2024, the Federal Trade Commission's rule banning noncompete agreements, which was blocked by a federal judge in Texas, is reinstated through legal or administrative means. Reinstatement must be confirmed through official announcements by the FTC, court rulings, or other authoritative legal sources, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). The reinstatement must be effective and not merely proposed or pending. If the rule is not reinstated and in effect by August 31, 2024, this part resolves as NO. Partial reinstatements or modifications to the original rule that still substantially ban noncompete agreements would qualify for a YES resolution. The overall condition is met only if both (a) and (b) conditions are met. 

Then, will Tennessee hold a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state constitution or law by August 31, 2024? The referendum must be officially conducted by the state government and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. For the purpose of this question, a 'referendum' refers to a direct vote by the electorate on a particular proposal, in this case regarding abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. Note that merely scheduling a referendum is not sufficient for a YES resolution; the actual vote must take place within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by August 2024: (a) a Texas woman's lawsuit over an abortion-related arrest reach a settlement, (b) the FTC's rule banning noncompete agreements be reinstated, and (c) Tennessee hold a referendum on abortion rights?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if all of the following conditions are met by their respective deadlines: (a) By July 31, 2024, a publicly confirmed settlement is reached in the lawsuit filed by a Texas woman against state authorities following her arrest and murder charge related to a self-managed abortion. The settlement must be officially announced by the involved parties or reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). If no such settlement is confirmed by the specified date, or if the case is dismissed or proceeds to trial without a settlement, this part resolves as NO. (b) By August 31, 2024, the Federal Trade Commission's rule banning noncompete agreements, which was blocked by a federal judge in Texas, is reinstated through legal or administrative means. Reinstatement must be confirmed through official announcements by the FTC, court rulings, or other authoritative legal sources, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). The reinstatement must be effective and not merely proposed or pending. If the rule is not reinstated and in effect by August 31, 2024, this part resolves as NO. Partial reinstatements or modifications to the original rule that still substantially ban noncompete agreements would qualify for a YES resolution. (c) By August 31, 2024, Tennessee holds a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state constitution or law. The referendum must be officially conducted by the state government and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. For the purpose of this question, a 'referendum' refers to a direct vote by the electorate on a particular proposal, in this case regarding abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. Note that merely scheduling a referendum is not sufficient for a YES resolution; the actual vote must take place within the specified timeframe. The overall question resolves as YES only if all conditions (a), (b), and (c) are met.

question.title: Will Lesetja Kganyago remain as Governor of the South African Reserve Bank through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Lesetja Kganyago is still serving as the Governor of the South African Reserve Bank on July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official South African Reserve Bank announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer serving as Governor by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not be considered as Kganyago remaining in the position.

question.title: Given Lesetja Kganyago remains as Governor of the South African Reserve Bank through July 2024, will the Bank of England announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Lesetja Kganyago remains as Governor of the South African Reserve Bank through July 2024. This means that as of July 31, 2024, he is still serving in that position, confirmed by official announcements from the South African Reserve Bank or reports by at least two major news outlets.

Then, is it true that the Bank of England will announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024? For this to be true, the Bank of England must publicly announce a reduction in its key interest rate, specifically the Bank Rate, by the specified date. This announcement must be officially made and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources. A mere hint or speculation does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction.

question.title: Conditional on Lesetja Kganyago remaining as Governor of the South African Reserve Bank through July 2024 and the Bank of England announcing a rate cut by August 2024, will the Central Bank of Thailand announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Lesetja Kganyago remains as Governor of the South African Reserve Bank through July 2024, and the Bank of England announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024. Given these conditions, will the Central Bank of Thailand announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition:
1. Lesetja Kganyago must still be serving as the Governor of the South African Reserve Bank on July 31, 2024, confirmed by official announcements or reported by major news outlets. If he is no longer serving as Governor for any reason, the condition is not met.
2. The Bank of England must officially announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024, confirmed by reputable financial news sources. The announcement must be concrete, not speculative.

Resolution criteria for the outcome:
- The Central Bank of Thailand must officially announce an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024, confirmed by official communications. The actual implementation date can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement occurs by that date.

question.title: Will Lesetja Kganyago remain as Governor of the South African Reserve Bank through July 2024, will the Bank of England announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024, and will the Central Bank of Thailand announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES only if all of the following conditions are met: (a) Lesetja Kganyago is still serving as the Governor of the South African Reserve Bank on July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official South African Reserve Bank announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer serving as Governor by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not be considered as Kganyago remaining in the position. (b) The Bank of England publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Bank of England and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. (c) The Bank of Thailand officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of Thailand communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the policy rate, which is the Bank of Thailand's primary tool for monetary policy. All three conditions must be satisfied for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will the Bank of Canada announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of Canada officially announces a decrease in its overnight rate target by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Bank of Canada or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual BoC members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given the Bank of Canada announces an interest rate cut by July 2024, will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with an employment support requirement by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Bank of Canada officially announces a decrease in its overnight rate target by July 31, 2024. The announcement is confirmed through official statements from the Bank of Canada or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut is a formal decision made by the Governing Council and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting.

Then, is it true that by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes an employment support requirement for beneficiaries? The employment support requirement must be a key component of the plan. There must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration.

question.title: Given both a Bank of Canada rate cut and a new U.S. state Medicaid employment support plan by July 2024, will GM resolve a major strike by then?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true by July 31, 2024: (a) The Bank of Canada officially announces a decrease in its overnight rate target, confirmed by official statements or major financial news sources, and (b) At least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan with an employment support requirement, confirmed by official announcements or reputable news sources.

Given these conditions, will General Motors reach an agreement with unionized workers to end a significant strike by July 31, 2024? The strike must involve at least 1,000 workers, last at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by both GM and the union, and reported by at least two reputable international news sources.

If the conditions (a) and (b) are met, does General Motors resolve the strike as described?

question.title: Will all of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Bank of Canada announces an interest rate cut, (b) Another U.S. state adopts a Medicaid plan with an employment support requirement, and (c) General Motors resolves a major workers' strike?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if all of the following events occur by July 31, 2024: (a) The Bank of Canada officially announces a decrease in its overnight rate target. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Bank of Canada or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual BoC members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, this part resolves as NO. (b) At least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes an employment support requirement for beneficiaries. The employment support requirement must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If no other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, this part resolves as NO. (c) General Motors reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid: 1. The strike must involve a substantial number of General Motors workers (at least 1,000 participants). 2. The strike must last for at least one week. 3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both General Motors and the involved union. 4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, this part resolves as NO. If all parts (a), (b), and (c) occur, the question resolves as YES. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of South Korea announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of South Korea officially announces a decrease in its Base Rate by July 31, 2024. question.title: Conditional on the Central Bank of South Korea announcing an interest rate cut by July 2024, will Massachusetts implement a free community college plan by July 2024?

question.title: Given both the Central Bank of South Korea announces an interest rate cut and Massachusetts implements a free community college plan by July 2024, will Google fund full tuition for all MIT engineering students by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true by July 31, 2024: (a) The Central Bank of South Korea officially announces a decrease in its Base Rate, confirmed through official statements or reported by major financial news sources, and (b) Massachusetts officially implements a free community college plan, confirmed by reputable news sources or official state announcements. - For the outcome: Resolves YES if Google's funding covers full tuition for all MIT engineering students by the resolution date, confirmed by official announcements or reputable news sources. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Central Bank of South Korea announces an interest rate cut (b) Massachusetts implements a free community college plan (c) Google funds full tuition for all MIT engineering students?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if all of the following events occur by July 31, 2024: (a) The Central Bank of South Korea officially announces a decrease in its Base Rate. question.title: Given the Central Bank of Turkey announces an interest rate cut by July 2024, will the Central Bank of Mexico announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?

question.title: Given both the Central Bank of Turkey and the Central Bank of Mexico announce interest rate cuts by August 2024, will the FTC's rule banning noncompete agreements be reinstated by August 2024?

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (1) The Central Bank of Turkey and the Central Bank of Mexico announce interest rate cuts, and (2) The FTC's rule banning noncompete agreements is reinstated?

question.title: Will the International Monetary Fund announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the International Monetary Fund officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official IMF channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments.
