question.title: Given the IMF announces new funding commitments over $400 million by July 2024, will a South Korean battery company's factory project in Ohio be canceled by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the International Monetary Fund officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official IMF channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments.

Then, will a South Korean lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a factory in Ohio be officially canceled by August 31, 2024? Confirmation of the cancellation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Ohio, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The cancellation must be a complete termination of the project, not just a delay or modification. If the project is still ongoing, under review, or has not been officially canceled by this date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'cancellation' means the company has formally withdrawn its plans or the state has definitively rejected the project.

question.title: Given both the IMF announces over $400M funding and a South Korean battery factory project in Ohio is canceled, will J.C. Penney emerge from bankruptcy by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, the International Monetary Fund officially announces new funding commitments totaling over $400 million through official channels, confirmed by at least two reputable news sources, and these are new initiatives or significant expansions, not continuations. (b) By August 31, 2024, a South Korean battery company's plan to build a factory in Ohio is officially canceled, confirmed by the company, the state of Ohio, or two credible news sources, and this is a complete termination, not a delay or modification.

Then, under these conditions, will J.C. Penney emerge from its Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings by July 31, 2024? This resolves as YES if J.C. Penney officially emerges from bankruptcy by this date, confirmed by at least two reputable financial news outlets or through official statements or court documents, involving a court-approved reorganization plan. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The IMF announces new funding commitments over $400 million by July 2024, (b) A South Korean battery company's Ohio factory project is canceled by August 2024, and (c) J.C. Penney emerges from bankruptcy by July 2024?
question.body:
(a) The IMF must officially announce new funding commitments totaling more than $400 million by July 31, 2024. These announcements must be made through official IMF channels and reported by at least two reputable news sources. The commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions, not continuations of previous commitments. If these conditions are not met, this part resolves as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, it must be confirmed that the South Korean lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a factory in Ohio has been officially canceled. Confirmation must come from official statements or at least two credible news sources. The cancellation must be a complete termination, not just a delay or modification. If the project is ongoing or not officially canceled, this part resolves as NO.

(c) J.C. Penney must officially emerge from Chapter 11 bankruptcy by July 31, 2024. This emergence must be confirmed by at least two reputable financial news outlets or through official statements or court documents. The emergence should involve a court-approved reorganization plan. If J.C. Penney remains in bankruptcy, is liquidated, or fails to emerge by the specified date, this part resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Hulu and Peacock announce a merger agreement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Hulu and Peacock publicly announce a merger agreement. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from either company or reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The merger agreement should involve the combination of the two companies' operations or assets in some form. This question does not require the merger to be completed by the resolution date, only that an agreement is announced. If no such announcement is made by July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given that Hulu and Peacock announce a merger agreement by July 2024, will a major social media platform be reported for spreading election misinformation through its AI systems by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, Hulu and Peacock publicly announce a merger agreement. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from either company or reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The merger agreement should involve the combination of the two companies' operations or assets in some form. This question does not require the merger to be completed by the resolution date, only that an agreement is announced. If no such announcement is made by July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

Then, is the following true? By August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a major social media platform is spreading election misinformation through its AI systems. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the platform and its AI systems' role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Given both a Hulu-Peacock merger announcement and social media AI election misinformation, will Virginia hold a privacy rights referendum by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

1. By July 31, 2024, Hulu and Peacock publicly announce a merger agreement, confirmed through official statements or reported by at least two major news organizations. This involves the combination of the two companies' operations or assets. 

2. By August 31, 2024, credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations state that a major social media platform is spreading election misinformation through its AI systems. The reports must specifically mention the platform and its AI systems' role in spreading election misinformation.

Given these conditions, will Virginia officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on privacy rights by August 31, 2024? The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address privacy rights, either proposing new protections or altering existing ones. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Hulu and Peacock announce a merger agreement by July 2024, (2) a major social media platform be reported for spreading election misinformation through its AI systems by August 2024, and (3) Virginia hold a referendum on privacy rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This combined question will resolve as YES if all of the following conditions are met:

1. By July 31, 2024, Hulu and Peacock publicly announce a merger agreement. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from either company or reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The merger agreement should involve the combination of the two companies' operations or assets in some form. This condition does not require the merger to be completed by the resolution date, only that an agreement is announced. If no such announcement is made by July 31, 2024, this part of the question resolves as NO.

2. By August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a major social media platform is spreading election misinformation through its AI systems. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the platform and its AI systems' role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, this part of the question will resolve as NO.

3. By August 31, 2024, Virginia officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on privacy rights. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address privacy rights, either proposing new protections or altering existing ones. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on privacy does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

The overall question resolves as YES only if all three conditions are met within their respective timeframes.

question.title: Will the White House announce conversion of additional vehicles to biofuel by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the White House officially announces that additional vehicles, beyond those already known, have been converted or are in the process of being converted to run on biofuel. The announcement must come from official White House channels or be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian). The additional vehicles must be part of the official fleet or directly associated with presidential transportation. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Given the White House announces conversion of additional vehicles to biofuel by July 2024, will the Bank of England announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the White House officially announces that additional vehicles, beyond those already known, have been converted or are in the process of being converted to run on biofuel. The announcement must come from official White House channels or be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian). The additional vehicles must be part of the official fleet or directly associated with presidential transportation. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

Then, is it true that the Bank of England will publicly announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024? The announcement must be officially made by the Bank of England and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given both a White House biofuel announcement and a Bank of England rate cut, will the US maintain a 100% tariff on Japanese cars through August 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the White House officially announces that additional vehicles, beyond those already known, have been converted or are in the process of being converted to run on biofuel. The announcement must come from official White House channels or be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian). The additional vehicles must be part of the official fleet or directly associated with presidential transportation. Also, by August 31, 2024, the Bank of England publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate. The announcement must be officially made by the Bank of England and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. Then, will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Japanese-made automobiles through August 2024? This question resolves as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Japanese-made automobiles. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The White House announces conversion of additional vehicles to biofuel by July 2024, (b) The Bank of England announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024, and (c) The United States maintains a 100% tariff on Japanese-made automobiles through August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if all of the following occur: (a) By July 31, 2024, the White House officially announces that additional vehicles, beyond those already known, have been converted or are in the process of being converted to run on biofuel. The announcement must come from official White House channels or be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian). The additional vehicles must be part of the official fleet or directly associated with presidential transportation. (b) By August 31, 2024, the Bank of England publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate. The announcement must be officially made by the Bank of England and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. (c) As of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Japanese-made automobiles. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question. If all three conditions (a), (b), and (c) are met by their respective deadlines, the question resolves as YES. If any one or more of these conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the reported death toll from the listeria outbreak linked to processed meats exceed 3 by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the number of reported deaths in the listeria outbreak linked to processed meats exceeds 3. The death toll must be confirmed by official health organizations such as the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) or other national health authorities. Alternatively, reports from at least three major reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times) citing official sources will be considered sufficient for confirmation. If the reported death toll remains at 3 or fewer by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Note that the outbreak must be specifically linked to processed meats, and deaths from other listeria outbreaks will not be considered for this question.

question.title: Given the reported death toll from the listeria outbreak linked to processed meats exceeds 3 by August 2024, will the Central Bank of New Zealand announce a new economic stimulus package by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, the number of reported deaths in the listeria outbreak linked to processed meats exceeds 3. The death toll is confirmed by official health organizations such as the CDC or other national health authorities, or by reports from at least three major reputable news sources citing official sources. The outbreak must be specifically linked to processed meats.

Then, will the Central Bank of New Zealand officially announce a new economic stimulus package by August 31, 2024? The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of New Zealand communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor, and should explicitly describe the new economic stimulus package. It must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets to be considered valid.

question.title: Given both a deadly listeria outbreak and a New Zealand economic stimulus, will a major oil spill occur in the North Sea by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following occurs by August 31, 2024: 
1. The reported death toll from a listeria outbreak linked to processed meats exceeds 3, confirmed by official health organizations or at least three major news sources. The outbreak must be linked specifically to processed meats.
2. The Central Bank of New Zealand announces a new economic stimulus package, confirmed by official communication and reported by at least two major financial news outlets.

Given these conditions, will there be a confirmed major oil spill in the North Sea by the same date, resulting from a tanker attack by an environmental activist group? A major oil spill is defined as one reported by at least two reputable international news sources and causing significant environmental damage, requiring large-scale cleanup efforts. The spill must be directly linked to an attack by an environmental activist group on a tanker in the North Sea.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by August 2024: (a) the reported death toll from the listeria outbreak linked to processed meats exceed 3, (b) the Central Bank of New Zealand announce a new economic stimulus package, and (c) a major oil spill occur in the North Sea?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if all of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) The number of reported deaths in the listeria outbreak linked to processed meats exceeds 3. The death toll must be confirmed by official health organizations such as the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) or other national health authorities. Alternatively, reports from at least three major reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times) citing official sources will be considered sufficient for confirmation. The outbreak must be specifically linked to processed meats, and deaths from other listeria outbreaks will not be considered. (b) The Central Bank of New Zealand officially announces a new economic stimulus package. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of New Zealand communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of New Zealand. The announcement should explicitly describe the new economic stimulus package and must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. (c) There is a confirmed major oil spill in the North Sea resulting from any tanker attacked by an environmental activist group. A major oil spill is defined as a spill that is reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, AP, BBC, or Al Jazeera) and causes significant environmental damage, requiring large-scale cleanup efforts. The spill must be directly linked to an attack by an environmental activist group on a tanker in the North Sea. If any of these conditions (a), (b), or (c) is not met by the specified date, this question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will South Korea become a member of the BRICS alliance by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, South Korea is formally accepted as a member of the BRICS alliance. For a positive resolution, the acceptance must be confirmed through official announcements from the BRICS alliance or any of its member countries (Brazil, Russia, India, China, South Africa) and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). The formal acceptance must include South Korea as a full member, not just an observer or associate member. If no such acceptance occurs by the resolution date, or if South Korea's membership is still pending or under consideration, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given South Korea joins BRICS by August 2024, will Medicare's negotiated drug prices include insulin by August 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, South Korea is formally accepted as a full member of the BRICS alliance, confirmed by official announcements from the BRICS alliance or any of its member countries (Brazil, Russia, India, China, South Africa) and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). Then, will the newly negotiated drug prices for Medicare, as mentioned in the Biden administration's announcement, include insulin and be confirmed to take effect by August 31, 2024? Confirmation must come from official announcements by Medicare, the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, or another relevant U.S. government agency, and the inclusion of insulin must be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). If insulin is not included in the negotiated prices by this date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given South Korea joins BRICS and Medicare includes insulin in drug prices, will Bloomberg Philanthropies donate $600M to Black schools?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, both (a) South Korea becomes a member of the BRICS alliance, confirmed through official announcements and reported by at least two reputable international news sources, and (b) Medicare's negotiated drug prices include insulin, confirmed by official announcements and reported by at least two reputable news sources.

Given these conditions, will Bloomberg Philanthropies announce a $600 million donation to the endowments of historically Black education schools by August 31, 2024? The donation must be officially announced and confirmed by at least two reputable news sources or through official statements from Bloomberg Philanthropies or the recipient institutions, specifically intended for the endowments of these schools. If no such announcement is made, or if the amount is less than $600 million, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by August 2024: (a) South Korea joins BRICS and Medicare includes insulin in negotiated prices, and (b) Bloomberg Philanthropies announces a $600 million donation to historically Black education schools?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if all of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) South Korea is formally accepted as a member of the BRICS alliance, confirmed through official announcements from the BRICS alliance or any of its member countries (Brazil, Russia, India, China, South Africa) and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). The formal acceptance must include South Korea as a full member, not just an observer or associate member. Additionally, the newly negotiated drug prices for Medicare, as mentioned in the Biden administration's announcement, must include insulin and be confirmed to take effect by August 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Medicare, the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, or another relevant U.S. government agency. The inclusion of insulin must be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). (b) Bloomberg Philanthropies must officially announce a donation of $600 million to the endowments of historically Black education schools. The announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers) or through official statements from Bloomberg Philanthropies or the recipient institutions. The donation must be specifically intended for the endowments of these education schools. If any of these conditions are not met by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Indiana conduct a referendum on public school funding by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting or modifying public school funding policies in the state. The referendum must be officially conducted by the state government and its results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. For the purpose of this question, a 'referendum' refers to a direct vote by the electorate on a particular proposal, in this case, related to public school funding. The question will resolve as NO if no such referendum occurs or is completed by the specified date, or if the referendum is postponed beyond August 31, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on Indiana conducting a referendum on public school funding by August 2024, will the average rate on a 30-year mortgage in the US fall below 5.8% by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting or modifying public school funding policies in the state. This referendum must be officially conducted by the state government and its results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. A 'referendum' refers to a direct vote by the electorate on a particular proposal related to public school funding. The question will resolve as NO if no such referendum occurs or is completed by the specified date, or if it is postponed beyond August 31, 2024.

Then, under this condition, the question is: Will the average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, fall below 5.8% at any point by August 31, 2024? This rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The rate must fall below 5.8% and a rate of exactly 5.8% will not count. If the rate does not fall below 5.8% by the specified date, or if Freddie Mac discontinues reporting this metric, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Given both a public school funding referendum in Indiana and a drop in 30-year mortgage rates below 5.8% by August 2024, will the US report a bumper harvest for corn and soybeans?
question.body: Suppose the following is true by August 31, 2024: (a) Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting or modifying public school funding policies, officially conducted by the state government and reported by credible sources. (b) The average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage in the US, as reported by Freddie Mac, falls below 5.8% at any point. Given these conditions, will the United States officially report a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans, defined as yields at least 10% higher than the five-year average, confirmed by the USDA or three reputable news outlets?

question.title: Will all of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Indiana conducts a referendum on public school funding, (b) the average rate on a 30-year mortgage in the US falls below 5.8%, and (c) the United States reports a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if all of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting or modifying public school funding policies in the state. The referendum must be officially conducted by the state government and its results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. A 'referendum' refers to a direct vote by the electorate on a particular proposal, in this case, related to public school funding. The question will resolve as NO if no such referendum occurs or is completed by the specified date, or if the referendum is postponed beyond August 31, 2024. (b) The average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, falls below 5.8% at any point. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. If the rate does not fall below 5.8% by the specified date, or if Freddie Mac discontinues reporting this metric, the question will resolve as NO. For clarity, a rate of exactly 5.8% will not be considered as falling below 5.8%. (c) The United States officially reports a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal). If a bumper harvest is reported for only one of the crops (either corn or soybeans) but not both, or if no bumper harvest is reported for either crop, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will IBM fund full tuition for all CMU computer science students by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, it is officially confirmed that IBM's funding is being used to cover full tuition for all computer science students at Carnegie Mellon University, regardless of their family income. The confirmation must come from official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. If the funding does not cover full tuition for all computer science students by the resolution date, or if it only covers tuition for a subset of students based on income or other criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Conditional on IBM funding full tuition for all CMU computer science students by July 2024, will Minnesota implement a free community college plan by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, it is officially confirmed that IBM's funding is being used to cover full tuition for all computer science students at Carnegie Mellon University, regardless of their family income. The confirmation must come from official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. If the funding does not cover full tuition for all computer science students by the resolution date, or if it only covers tuition for a subset of students based on income or other criteria, the condition is not met.

Given this condition is met, will Minnesota implement a free community college plan by July 31, 2024? This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Minnesota has officially implemented a free community college plan. Implementation is confirmed if students are able to enroll in community colleges without tuition fees, as reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as local Minnesota newspapers, national news outlets, or official state government announcements). The plan must be part of a state-wide initiative, not limited to specific institutions or pilot programs. If no such implementation occurs by the resolution date, or if the implementation is only partial or limited, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Conditional on both IBM funding full tuition for all CMU computer science students and Minnesota implementing a free community college plan by July 2024, will the ILO announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true by July 31, 2024: (a) IBM funds full tuition for all CMU computer science students, confirmed by official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources, covering all students regardless of income; and (b) Minnesota implements a state-wide free community college plan, confirmed by reports from at least two reputable news sources or official state announcements, allowing students to enroll without tuition fees and not limited to specific institutions or pilot programs.

Given these conditions, will the International Labour Organization officially announce new funding commitments totaling more than $400 million by July 31, 2024? The announcement(s) must be made through official ILO channels and reported by at least two reputable news sources. The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made or if the total does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by July 2024: (a) IBM funds full tuition for all CMU computer science students, (b) Minnesota implements a free community college plan, and (c) the International Labour Organization announces new funding commitments totaling over $400 million?
question.body:
(a) IBM funds full tuition for all CMU computer science students: This resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, it is confirmed that IBM's funding covers full tuition for all computer science students at Carnegie Mellon University, as per official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. The funding must cover all students regardless of income.

(b) Minnesota implements a free community college plan: This resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Minnesota has implemented a state-wide free community college plan, confirmed by reports from at least two reputable news sources or official state announcements. Students must be able to enroll without tuition fees, and the plan should not be limited to specific institutions or pilot programs.

(c) The International Labour Organization announces new funding commitments totaling over $400 million: This resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the International Labour Organization officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official ILO channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments.

question.title: Will Medicare's negotiated drug prices be reduced by more than 10% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the newly negotiated drug prices for Medicare, as mentioned in the Biden administration's announcement, result in a reduction of more than 10% by August 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Medicare, the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, or another relevant U.S. government agency. The reduction must be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). If the reduction is not more than 10% by this date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Conditional on Medicare's negotiated drug prices being reduced by more than 10% by August 2024, will Tencent Holdings resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Medicare's newly negotiated drug prices result in a reduction of more than 10% by August 31, 2024, confirmed by official announcements from Medicare, the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, or another relevant U.S. government agency, and reported by at least two reputable news sources.

Given this condition, will Tencent Holdings reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024? For the resolution to be considered valid, the strike must involve at least 1,000 participants, last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Tencent Holdings and the involved union, and reported by at least two reputable international news sources.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Given both Medicare's drug prices are reduced by more than 10% by August 2024 and Tencent resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024, will the U.S. maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese batteries through August 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Medicare's negotiated drug prices are reduced by more than 10% by August 31, 2024, confirmed by official announcements and reported by at least two reputable news sources; and (b) Tencent Holdings resolves a major workers' strike involving at least 1,000 workers by July 31, 2024, confirmed by official statements and reported by at least two reputable news sources. Given these conditions are met, will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made batteries through August 31, 2024? The tariff's existence must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations. If the tariff is reduced below 100% or removed by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers that do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by their respective deadlines: (a) Medicare's negotiated drug prices be reduced by more than 10%, (b) Tencent Holdings resolve a major workers' strike, AND (c) the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made batteries?
question.body:
(a) Medicare's negotiated drug prices must be reduced by more than 10% by August 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Medicare, the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, or another relevant U.S. government agency. The reduction must be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). If the reduction is not more than 10% by this date, the question resolves as NO.

(b) Tencent Holdings must reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. The strike must involve at least 1,000 participants, last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Tencent Holdings and the involved union, reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

(c) The United States must continue to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made batteries as of August 31, 2024. The tariff rate must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

This question will resolve as YES only if all of the above conditions (a, b, and c) are met by their respective deadlines.

question.title: Will California hold a referendum on gun control laws by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of California officially conducts a referendum regarding gun control laws. The referendum must be a formal, state-wide vote on a proposed constitutional amendment or legislative measure specifically addressing gun control laws. The occurrence of the referendum must be verifiable through official state government announcements or reports from at least three major, reputable news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). If no such referendum is held by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only concerns the occurrence of the referendum itself, not its outcome.

question.title: Conditional on California holding a referendum on gun control laws by July 2024, will Illinois conduct a referendum on healthcare policy by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the state of California officially conducts a referendum regarding gun control laws. This referendum must be a formal, state-wide vote on a proposed constitutional amendment or legislative measure specifically addressing gun control laws, and its occurrence must be verifiable through official state government announcements or reports from at least three major, reputable news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN).

Then, is it true that by August 31, 2024, Illinois conducts a public referendum specifically focused on implementing or revising healthcare policies in the state? This referendum must be officially conducted by the state government and its results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. For the purpose of this question, a 'referendum' refers to a direct vote by the electorate on a particular proposal, in this case, related to healthcare policy. The question will resolve as NO if no such referendum occurs or is completed by the specified date, or if the referendum is postponed beyond August 31, 2024.

question.title: Given California and Illinois hold referendums on gun control and healthcare by mid-2024, will Bloomberg Philanthropies announce a $600 million donation to historically Black law schools by August 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, California conducts a formal, state-wide referendum on gun control laws, verifiable through official state announcements or reports from major news organizations, and by August 31, 2024, Illinois conducts a public referendum on healthcare policies, officially reported by credible sources. Then, will Bloomberg Philanthropies announce a $600 million donation to the endowments of historically Black law schools by August 31, 2024? The announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable news sources or official statements, and must be specifically intended for the endowments of these law schools. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the announced amount is less than $600 million, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) California and Illinois hold referendums on gun control laws and healthcare policy by July and August 2024, respectively, and (2) Bloomberg Philanthropies announces a $600 million donation to historically Black law schools by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur: (1) Both California and Illinois conduct referendums as specified: (a) By July 31, 2024, California must officially conduct a referendum regarding gun control laws. This referendum must be a formal, state-wide vote on a proposed constitutional amendment or legislative measure specifically addressing gun control laws, verifiable through official state government announcements or reports from at least three reputable news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). (b) By August 31, 2024, Illinois must conduct a public referendum specifically focused on implementing or revising healthcare policies, officially conducted by the state government and reported by credible news sources or official state channels. If either of these referendums does not occur by the specified dates, the question resolves as NO. (2) Bloomberg Philanthropies must officially announce a donation of $600 million to the endowments of historically Black law schools by August 31, 2024. This announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable news sources or through official statements from Bloomberg Philanthropies or the recipient institutions. The donation must be specifically intended for the endowments of these law schools. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the announced amount is less than $600 million, this part resolves as NO. The overall question resolves as YES only if both parts (1) and (2) are satisfied.

question.title: Will North Carolina's abortion law allowing procedures up to 20 weeks remain unchanged by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, North Carolina's current abortion law permitting abortions up to 20 weeks remains in effect without any changes. The status of the law must be confirmed by official state legislative records or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or local North Carolina newspapers). If the law is modified, replaced, or overturned by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. This includes any changes that either restrict or expand the current 20-week limit.

question.title: Conditional on North Carolina's abortion law remaining unchanged, will Brazil close its investigation into Merck's diabetes drug pricing by July 2024?
question.body:

Given this condition, will Brazil close its investigation into Merck's diabetes drug pricing by July 2024? This resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Brazilian authorities officially announce the closure of their investigation into Merck regarding the pricing of a diabetes drug, confirmed by at least two major news outlets. The investigation must be specifically related to the pricing of a diabetes medication produced by Merck. If no such closure is announced by the specified date, or if the investigation remains ongoing, this resolves as NO. A temporary suspension or pause in the investigation does not count as closure for this question.

question.title: Given North Carolina's abortion law remains unchanged and Brazil closes its investigation into Merck, will Texas's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024?

If the law is modified, replaced, or overturned by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. This includes any changes that either restrict or expand the current 20-week limit. (2) By July 31, 2024, the Brazilian authorities officially announce the closure of their investigation into Merck regarding the pricing of a diabetes drug. The closure must be confirmed by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or local Brazilian news agencies of similar repute). The investigation in question must be specifically related to the pricing of a diabetes medication produced by Merck. If no such closure is announced by the specified date, or if the investigation remains ongoing, the question will resolve as NO. Note that a temporary suspension or pause in the investigation does not count as closure for the purpose of this question. (3) By August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Texas's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from a Texas state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 250,000 for two consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 250,000 for two consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

question.title: Given U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 250,000 for two consecutive weeks by August 2024, will Colorado receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects by July 2024?

question.title: Will X's AI chatbot Grok be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that the AI chatbot Grok on the social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter) is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Grok and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Given Grok is reported for spreading election misinformation, will the U.S. Transportation Department's airline fee disclosure rule be in effect by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that the AI chatbot Grok on the social media platform X is spreading election misinformation. Then, is the following true: By July 31, 2024, the U.S. Transportation Department's rule requiring airlines to more clearly disclose fees for baggage and ticket changes is officially in effect and being enforced, confirmed by official announcements or major news outlets?

question.title: Given both Grok's misinformation and airline fee rule enforcement, will Carles Puigdemont face trial in Spain by August 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) By August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that the AI chatbot Grok on the social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter) is spreading election misinformation. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. Then, will Carles Puigdemont, the former leader of Catalonia, be officially put on trial in Spain for his involvement in organizing the 2017 Catalan independence referendum by August 31, 2024? The trial must be formally initiated in a Spanish court, with Puigdemont physically present or represented by legal counsel, and the charges must be directly related to Puigdemont's role in the 2017 referendum, which was declared illegal by Spanish authorities. question.title: Will all of the following occur by August 2024: (a) X's AI chatbot Grok be reported for spreading election misinformation, (b) the U.S. Transportation Department's rule on airline fee disclosure be in effect, and (c) Carles Puigdemont face a trial in Spain related to the 2017 Catalan independence referendum?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if all of the following conditions are met by their respective deadlines in 2024: (a) By August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that the AI chatbot Grok on the social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter) is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Grok and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, this condition will resolve as NO. (b) By July 31, 2024, the U.S. Transportation Department's rule requiring airlines to more clearly disclose fees for baggage and ticket changes is officially in effect and being enforced. The implementation must be confirmed by official announcements from the U.S. Transportation Department or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, The New York Times, or The Wall Street Journal). If the rule remains blocked, is overturned, or is not implemented and enforced by the resolution date, this condition resolves as NO. (c) By August 31, 2024, Carles Puigdemont, the former leader of Catalonia, is officially put on trial in Spain for his involvement in organizing the 2017 Catalan independence referendum. The trial must be formally initiated in a Spanish court, with Puigdemont physically present or represented by legal counsel. For the purpose of this question, 'trial' refers to the commencement of legal proceedings in a court of law, not merely an indictment or charges being filed. The charges must be directly related to Puigdemont's role in the 2017 referendum, which was declared illegal by Spanish authorities. If no such trial begins by the specified date, or if Puigdemont is granted immunity or amnesty that prevents a trial from occurring, the question will resolve as NO. The overall question will resolve as YES only if all conditions (a), (b), and (c) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will the European Central Bank announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the European Central Bank officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official ECB communications, such as press releases, Governing Council statements, or public speeches by ECB officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the main refinancing operations rate, which is the ECB's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will the FCA announce completion of a major financial fraud investigation by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) of the UK officially announces the completion of its investigation into financial fraud involving at least five major financial institutions. Completion must be confirmed through an official FCA announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the FCA does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given the FCA announces completion of a major financial fraud investigation by July 2024, will the average rate on a 30-year mortgage in the US fall below 5.9% by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) of the UK officially announces the completion of its investigation into financial fraud involving at least five major financial institutions. Note that a rate of exactly 5.9% will not be considered as falling below 5.9%.

question.title: Given both the FCA completes a major financial fraud investigation and US mortgage rates fall below 5.9%, will Dean & DeLuca emerge from bankruptcy by July 2024?

If Dean & DeLuca remains in bankruptcy proceedings, is liquidated, or fails to emerge from bankruptcy by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by July 2024: (1) The FCA completes a major financial fraud investigation, (2) The average US 30-year mortgage rate falls below 5.9% by August 2024, and (3) Dean & DeLuca emerges from bankruptcy?

question.title: Will a member of the U.S. Supreme Court use an AI-generated voice clone for a public address by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a member of the U.S. Supreme Court is confirmed to have used an AI-generated voice clone during a public address.
