question.title: Will Germany's monthly job growth fall below 20,000 in any single month by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Germany records a monthly job growth figure below 20,000 in any official jobs report. The data must be confirmed by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany in their monthly employment reports. Job growth refers to the net change in employment. Revisions to previous months' data will not be considered for this question's resolution. If job growth does not fall below 20,000 in any month from October 2023 through July 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given Germany's monthly job growth falls below 20,000 in any single month by July 2024, will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024?
question.body:
This question combines two conditions: 

1. Suppose Germany records a monthly job growth figure below 20,000 in any official jobs report by July 31, 2024. This data must be confirmed by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany. Job growth refers to the net change in employment, and revisions to previous months' data will not be considered.

2. Given the above condition is met, will the United States continue to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery as of August 31, 2024? The tariff's existence and rate must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations. If the tariff is reduced below 100% or removed before August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers that do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect this resolution.

If the first condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Given both Germany's job growth falls and the US maintains tariffs, will the European Commission complete a major antitrust investigation by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both (a) Germany's monthly job growth falls below 20,000 in any single month by July 2024, and (b) the United States maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024. 

Details for (a): By July 31, 2024, Germany must record a monthly job growth figure below 20,000 in any official jobs report, confirmed by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany. Revisions to previous months' data will not be considered.

Details for (b): As of August 31, 2024, the United States must continue to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery. If the tariff is reduced below 100% or removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, this part resolves as NO.

Then, is the following true: Will the European Commission announce the completion of a major antitrust investigation by July 2024?

Resolution criteria for this outcome: Resolves YES if, by July 31, 2024, the European Commission officially announces the completion of its antitrust investigation involving at least five major companies, confirmed through an official announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by their respective deadlines: (1) Germany's monthly job growth falls below 20,000 in any single month by July 2024, (2) the United States maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024, and (3) the European Commission announces completion of a major antitrust investigation by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES only if all of the following conditions are met: (1) By July 31, 2024, Germany records a monthly job growth figure below 20,000 in any official jobs report, confirmed by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany in their monthly employment reports. Job growth refers to the net change in employment, and revisions to previous months' data will not be considered for this question's resolution. If job growth does not fall below 20,000 in any month from October 2023 through July 2024, this part of the question resolves as NO. (2) As of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery, verifiable through official U.S. government sources and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations. If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, this part of the question resolves as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question. (3) By July 31, 2024, the European Commission officially announces the completion of its antitrust investigation involving at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official European Commission announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the European Commission does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, the question resolves as NO. The combined question resolves as YES only if all three conditions (1), (2), and (3) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will Nevada enact legislation restricting the public carrying of non-firearm weapons by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Nevada officially passes and enacts legislation that imposes new restrictions on the public carrying of non-firearm weapons, such as bladed weapons or other non-firearm implements. The legislation must specifically address the carrying of these weapons in public spaces. For a YES resolution, the new law must be officially enacted and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, local Nevada news outlets). If no such legislation is passed and enacted by the specified date, or if any enacted legislation does not specifically restrict the public carrying of non-firearm weapons, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Given Nevada enacts legislation restricting public carrying of non-firearm weapons by August 2024, will Wisconsin enact stricter abortion regulations by July 2024?

The legislation specifically addresses the carrying of these weapons in public spaces, and this is reported by at least two reputable news sources.

Then, is it true that by July 31, 2024, Wisconsin enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers? The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources, with stricter requirements potentially including additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers.

question.title: Given Nevada and Wisconsin enact specified laws, will YouTube face new U.S. legal actions by August 2024?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Nevada enacts legislation restricting the public carrying of non-firearm weapons by August 2024, (b) Wisconsin enacts new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024, and (c) YouTube faces additional legal actions from the U.S. government by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if all of the following conditions are met: (a) By August 31, 2024, Nevada officially passes and enacts legislation that imposes new restrictions on the public carrying of non-firearm weapons, such as bladed weapons or other non-firearm implements. The legislation must specifically address the carrying of these weapons in public spaces, and the new law must be officially enacted and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, local Nevada news outlets). (b) By July 31, 2024, Wisconsin enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. (c) By August 31, 2024, YouTube becomes subject to new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity. These legal actions may include, but are not limited to, lawsuits or regulatory actions. To qualify, the legal actions must be officially announced and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The legal actions must be distinct from any ongoing cases or settlements as of October 1, 2023. If any of these conditions is not met, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Australia's ASX 200 index reach or exceed 7,800 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Australia's ASX 200 index reaches or exceeds 7,800 points. The 7,800 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Australian Securities Exchange. If the index does not reach 7,800 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 7,800 points.

question.title: Given Australia's ASX 200 index reaches or exceeds 7,800 points by August 2024, will a major Chinese battery company begin construction of a factory in Virginia by the same date?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Australia's ASX 200 index reaches or exceeds 7,800 points at any time, including intraday highs. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Australian Securities Exchange.

Given this condition, will a major Chinese battery company begin construction of a factory in Virginia by August 31, 2024? For this to resolve as YES, construction on a large-scale lithium-ion battery factory in Virginia, owned by a Chinese company, must have officially commenced by this date. Confirmation must come from at least two of the following sources: official company announcements, statements from the Virginia state government, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal). The commencement of construction should involve significant on-site activities such as groundbreaking, foundation work, or major earthmoving operations. Mere preparatory activities like site clearing or permitting processes do not qualify as construction commencement. If no such construction has begun by the specified date, or if the project is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given both Australia's ASX 200 index reaches 7,800 and a Chinese battery company starts construction in Virginia, will Saudi Arabia eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Australia's ASX 200 index reaches or exceeds 7,800 points at any point between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024, verified by reputable financial data sources, and (b) by August 31, 2024, construction on a large-scale lithium-ion battery factory in Virginia, owned by a Chinese company, has officially commenced, confirmed by official announcements or major news reports. Then, will Saudi Arabia eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 31, 2024, confirmed by official government announcements or reports by reputable international news outlets? The elimination must be complete, not partial.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by their respective deadlines: (1) Australia's ASX 200 index reaches or exceeds 7,800 points and a major Chinese battery company begins construction of a factory in Virginia, and (2) Saudi Arabia eliminates export taxes on agricultural products?
question.body:
(1) By August 31, 2024, both of the following must occur: 
(a) Australia's ASX 200 index must reach or exceed 7,800 points at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024. This includes intraday highs and does not require the index to close at or above this level. Verification will be based on reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Australian Securities Exchange. If the index does not reach 7,800 points during this period, this condition is not met.
(b) By August 31, 2024, construction on a large-scale lithium-ion battery factory in Virginia, owned by a Chinese company, must have officially commenced. Confirmation must come from at least two sources: official company announcements, statements from the Virginia state government, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal). The commencement of construction should involve significant on-site activities such as groundbreaking, foundation work, or major earthmoving operations. Mere preparatory activities do not qualify. If no such construction has begun by the specified date, or if the project is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, this condition is not met.

(2) By July 31, 2024, the Saudi Arabian government must officially announce or implement a policy to completely eliminate export taxes on agricultural products. The policy must be confirmed by official government communications or reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such policy is introduced or implemented by the resolution date, or if only partial measures are taken, the question resolves as NO.

The question resolves as YES only if all conditions in both (1) and (2) are met by their respective deadlines. If any condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will South Africa's National Council of Provinces pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Ramaphosa by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, South Africa's National Council of Provinces passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Cyril Ramaphosa or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the National Council of Provinces, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Ramaphosa or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the South African economy.

If no such bill is passed by the National Council of Provinces by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will France's CAC 40 index reach or exceed 7,500 points by August 2024?

question.title: Will San Francisco announce plans to restrict short-term rental units by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the city government of San Francisco officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units (such as those typically listed on platforms like Airbnb) within the city. The announcement must come from an official source within San Francisco's local government and be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The restrictions or regulations should be specifically targeted at reducing the number of short-term rental units available to tourists or altering the way they operate. Mere discussions or proposals without a formal announcement will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such official announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: If San Francisco announces plans to restrict short-term rental units by July 2024, will Nebraska hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the city government of San Francisco officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units within the city. This announcement must come from an official source within San Francisco's local government and be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The restrictions or regulations should be specifically targeted at reducing the number of short-term rental units available to tourists or altering the way they operate.

Given this, will Nebraska officially conduct a statewide referendum on the topic of abortion rights by July 31, 2024? The referendum must be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. For a YES resolution, the referendum must be officially announced by the Nebraska state government and the voting process must be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources. If no such referendum is held or completed by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Given both San Francisco announces plans to restrict short-term rentals and Nebraska holds a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024, will the U.S. Senate pass a bill to cut the NIH's budget by more than 20% by August 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, both (a) the city government of San Francisco officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting the availability of short-term rental units, with the announcement reported by at least two reputable international news organizations, and (b) Nebraska conducts a statewide referendum on abortion rights, with the occurrence and results reported by at least two major news sources. Then, will the U.S. Senate pass a bill by August 31, 2024, that includes a reduction of more than 20% in the budget of the National Institutes of Health (NIH) compared to its current fiscal year's budget, with the passage confirmed by official Senate records and reported by at least two major news organizations? If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by August 2024: (1) San Francisco announces plans to restrict short-term rental units, (2) Nebraska holds a referendum on abortion rights, and (3) the U.S. Senate passes a bill to cut the NIH's budget by more than 20%?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if all of the following occur by their respective deadlines: (1) By July 31, 2024, the city government of San Francisco officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units (such as those typically listed on platforms like Airbnb) within the city. The announcement must come from an official source within San Francisco's local government and be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The restrictions or regulations should be specifically targeted at reducing the number of short-term rental units available to tourists or altering the way they operate. Mere discussions or proposals without a formal announcement will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. (2) By July 31, 2024, Nebraska officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. The referendum must be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. For a YES resolution, the referendum must be officially announced by the Nebraska state government and the voting process must be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). (3) By August 31, 2024, the United States Senate passes a bill that includes a reduction of more than 20% in the budget of the National Institutes of Health (NIH) compared to its current fiscal year's budget. The passage must be confirmed by official Senate records and reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). If any of these conditions (1), (2), or (3) is not met by their respective deadlines, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Biogen's ALS treatment receive European marketing approval by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if Biogen's ALS treatment receives marketing approval from the European Medicines Agency (EMA) by July 31, 2024. The approval must be officially announced by the EMA and reported by at least two reputable news sources. If no such approval is granted by the resolution date, or if the EMA explicitly rejects the approval, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question is based on the regulatory process as of October 1, 2023, and does not take into account any specific committee recommendations or decisions made after this date.

question.title: Conditional on Biogen's ALS treatment receiving European marketing approval by July 2024, will Medicare's negotiated drug prices include a major diabetes medication by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biogen's ALS treatment receives marketing approval from the European Medicines Agency (EMA) by July 31, 2024. The approval must be officially announced by the EMA and reported by at least two reputable news sources.

Then, will the newly negotiated drug prices for Medicare, as mentioned in the Biden administration's announcement, include a major diabetes medication and are confirmed to take effect by August 31, 2024? Confirmation must come from official announcements by Medicare, the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, or another relevant U.S. government agency. The inclusion of the medication must be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal).

question.title: Given both Biogen's ALS treatment receives EU approval and Medicare includes a major diabetes drug, will the Clinton Foundation announce over $400 million in new funding by July 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Both (a) Biogen's ALS treatment receives European marketing approval by July 31, 2024, with confirmation from the EMA and two reputable news sources, and (b) Medicare's negotiated drug prices include a major diabetes medication, confirmed by official announcements and reported by two reputable news sources, taking effect by August 31, 2024. Then, will the Clinton Foundation announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 31, 2024? The announcement must be made through official Clinton Foundation channels and reported by at least two reputable news sources. The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Biogen's ALS treatment receive European marketing approval by July 2024, (b) Medicare's negotiated drug prices include a major diabetes medication by August 2024, and (c) the Clinton Foundation announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if all of the following conditions are met: (a) Biogen's ALS treatment receives marketing approval from the European Medicines Agency (EMA) by July 31, 2024. The approval must be officially announced by the EMA and reported by at least two reputable news sources. If no such approval is granted by the resolution date, or if the EMA explicitly rejects the approval, this condition resolves as NO. (b) The newly negotiated drug prices for Medicare, as mentioned in the Biden administration's announcement, include a major diabetes medication and are confirmed to take effect by August 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Medicare, the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, or another relevant U.S. government agency. The inclusion of the medication must be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). If the medication is not included in the negotiated prices by this date, this condition resolves as NO. (c) By July 31, 2024, the Clinton Foundation officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official Clinton Foundation channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, this condition resolves as NO. The overall question resolves as YES only if all conditions (a), (b), and (c) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of Australia announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of Australia publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Reserve Bank of Australia and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the cash rate, which is the RBA's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given the Reserve Bank of Australia announces a rate cut by August 2024, will Facebook's AI moderation be reported for election misinformation by then?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Reserve Bank of Australia publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. This announcement must be officially made by the Reserve Bank of Australia and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the cash rate, which is the RBA's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. 

Then, is it true that by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Facebook's AI content moderation system is spreading election misinformation? For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Facebook's AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation.

question.title: Given both an RBA rate cut and Facebook AI misinformation by August 2024, will Apple announce AI energy reduction measures by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following are true by August 31, 2024:

(a) The Reserve Bank of Australia publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate, officially reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the cash rate, which is the RBA's primary tool for influencing the economy.

(b) There are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Facebook's AI content moderation system is spreading election misinformation. These reports must come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals, specifically mentioning Facebook's AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation.

Given these conditions, will Apple announce specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations by July 31, 2024? The announcement must be made through official company channels or reported by at least two major news outlets, and the measures should specifically target AI-related electricity consumption.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by July 2024: (1) The Reserve Bank of Australia announces a reduction in its key interest rate, (2) Facebook's AI content moderation system is reported for spreading election misinformation, and (3) Apple announces measures to reduce AI-related electricity consumption?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if all of the following conditions are met by their respective dates:

The reduction must be in the cash rate, which is the RBA's primary tool for influencing the economy. (2) By August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Facebook's AI content moderation system is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Facebook's AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation.

(3) By July 31, 2024, Apple officially announces specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations. If any of these conditions are not met by their specified dates, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 30-year mortgage in the US fall below 6.2% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, falls below 6.2% at any point. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. If the rate does not fall below 6.2% by the specified date, or if Freddie Mac discontinues reporting this metric, the question will resolve as NO. For clarity, a rate of exactly 6.2% will not be considered as falling below 6.2%.

question.title: Given the US 30-year mortgage rate falls below 6.2% by August 2024, will the Shanghai Composite index recover to its October 2023 level by August 2024?
question.body:

For clarity, a rate of exactly 6.2% will not be considered as falling below 6.2%.

Then, will the Shanghai Composite index recover to its October 2023 level by August 2024? This resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Shanghai Composite index closes at or above its closing level as of October 1, 2023. The closing level will be verified using data from reputable financial information providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or Financial Times. If the Shanghai Composite index does not reach or exceed its October 1, 2023 closing level by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. In case of any stock splits or reverse splits during this period, the index value will be adjusted accordingly for fair comparison.

question.title: Given both US mortgage rates fall below 6.2% and Shanghai Composite recovers, will Japan's interest rate stay above 0.50% in August 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true by August 31, 2024: (a) The average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States falls below 6.2% as confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two reputable financial news sources. (b) The Shanghai Composite index closes at or above its closing level as of October 1, 2023, verified by data from reputable financial information providers. Given these conditions, will the Bank of Japan's policy interest rate remain at or above 0.50% at any point during August 2024? Confirmation must come from official Bank of Japan announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources. If the rate decreases below 0.50% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The average rate on a 30-year mortgage in the US falls below 6.2%, (b) The Shanghai Composite index recovers to its October 2023 level, and (c) The Bank of Japan's interest rate remains at or above 0.50% in August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if all of the following conditions are met: (a) By August 31, 2024, the average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, falls below 6.2% at any point. This must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. question.title: Will Apple finalize a union contract with store employees in Michigan by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Apple has finalized and officially signed a collective bargaining contract with the unionized store employees in Michigan. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The contract must be the first of its kind for Apple in the United States. If no such finalization and signing of the contract occurs by the specified date, or if the contract is still in a tentative or non-finalized state, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given Apple finalizes a union contract with store employees in Michigan by July 2024, will Sony Corporation resolve a major workers' strike by then?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, Apple has finalized and officially signed a collective bargaining contract with the unionized store employees in Michigan. This must be confirmed by official announcements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The contract must be the first of its kind for Apple in the United States. 

Then, will Sony Corporation reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024? For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given both Apple finalizing a union contract in Michigan and Sony resolving a major strike by July 2024, will Nebraska enact a new law modifying restrictions on transgender youth medical care by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true by July 31, 2024: (a) Apple has finalized and officially signed a collective bargaining contract with the unionized store employees in Michigan, confirmed by official announcements or reputable news sources, and this is the first of its kind for Apple in the U.S.; and (b) Sony Corporation has reached an agreement with unionized workers, ending a significant strike involving at least 1,000 workers and lasting for at least one week, confirmed by official statements and reputable news sources.

Then, will the state of Nebraska enact a new law by July 31, 2024, that modifies or replaces current restrictions on medical care for transgender youth, confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by major news outlets? If no such law is enacted or if any enacted law does not modify the current restrictions, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Apple finalize a union contract with store employees in Michigan, (b) Sony Corporation resolve a major workers' strike, and (c) Nebraska enact a new law modifying restrictions on medical care for transgender youth?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if all of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024:

(a) Apple has finalized and officially signed a collective bargaining contract with the unionized store employees in Michigan. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The contract must be the first of its kind for Apple in the United States. If no such finalization and signing of the contract occurs by the specified date, or if the contract is still in a tentative or non-finalized state, this condition is not met.

(b) Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. The strike must involve a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants) and last for at least one week. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union, and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, this condition is not met.

(c) By July 31, 2024, the state of Nebraska enacts a new law that modifies or replaces the current restrictions on medical care for transgender youth. The enactment must be confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or local Nebraska news stations). The new law must specifically address and alter the existing restrictions on medical care for transgender youth in Nebraska. If no such law is enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted law does not modify the current restrictions, this condition is not met.

If all conditions (a), (b), and (c) are satisfied by the specified date, the question resolves as YES. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Indiana receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Indiana is confirmed to have been awarded more than $300 million in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects. The grants must be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within Indiana. If the total amount of such grants awarded to Indiana does not exceed $300 million by the specified date, or if there is insufficient evidence to confirm such an award, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Conditional on Indiana receiving over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects by July 2024, will Union Pacific implement a new scheduling system for passenger train services by August 2024?

question.title: Will Cruise's robotaxis be available on Uber's ride-hailing service in Africa by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Cruise's autonomous vehicles (robotaxis) are confirmed to be operational and available for passenger rides through Uber's ride-hailing service in at least one African city. Confirmation must come from official statements by either Cruise or Uber, or reports from at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, TechCrunch). The service must be publicly accessible to regular Uber users, not just for testing or limited trials. If no such availability is confirmed by the resolution date, or if the partnership is canceled or indefinitely delayed, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: If Cruise's robotaxis are available on Uber in Africa by August 2024, will the US maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese machinery through August 2024?

question.title: Will an enforceable ethics code for U.S. immigration judges be established by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, an enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. immigration judges is officially adopted by the United States government. The adoption must be confirmed by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting immigration judges. It should outline clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement. question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) The U.S. Senate passes a bill to cut the EPA's budget by more than 20% by August 2024, (2) Brazil's monthly job growth falls below 50,000 in any single month by July 2024, and (3) Large protests occur in Brazil in response to deforestation policies by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if all of the following conditions are met: (1) By August 31, 2024, the United States Senate passes a bill that includes a reduction of more than 20% in the budget of the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) compared to its current fiscal year's budget. The passage must be confirmed by official Senate records and reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). If no such bill is passed by the Senate by the resolution date, or if a bill is passed but the budget cut is 20% or less, this condition is not met. Note that mere proposals or discussions of budget cuts do not count; the bill must be officially passed by the Senate. (2) By July 31, 2024, Brazil records a monthly job growth figure below 50,000 in any official jobs report. The data must be confirmed by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics in their monthly employment reports. Job growth refers to the net change in employment. Revisions to previous months' data will not be considered for this condition's resolution. If job growth does not fall below 50,000 in any month from October 2023 through July 2024, this condition is not met. (3) By July 31, 2024, there are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in Brazil specifically in response to the government's decision regarding deforestation policies. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across Brazil. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of deforestation policies. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the policy is rescinded before causing such protests, this condition will not be met. The question resolves as NO if any of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will Evan Gershkovich be released from Russian custody by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Evan Gershkovich, a Wall Street Journal reporter currently held in Russia on espionage charges, is released from Russian custody by July 31, 2024. The release must be confirmed through official announcements from the Russian or U.S. governments, or reports from at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or The New York Times). Release means Gershkovich is no longer in detention and is free to leave Russia. Temporary releases for court appearances or medical reasons do not count. If Gershkovich remains in Russian custody as of July 31, 2024, or if his status is unclear, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Netflix appeal a major fine from the Norwegian data protection watchdog by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Netflix files an official appeal against a significant fine imposed by the Norwegian data protection watchdog related to the alleged transfer of European users' personal data to the United States without adequate protection. The appeal must be confirmed by official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Financial Times). If no such appeal is filed or confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, a 'significant fine' is defined as one exceeding 100 million euros.

question.title: Will California receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects by July 2024?

The grants must be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within California. question.title: Will Paris announce a public transit-only policy for its 2024 Olympic venues by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Mayor of Paris or an official representative of the city government announces a policy stating that all venues for the 2024 Summer Olympics will be accessible only by public transportation. The announcement must be made through official channels (such as a press conference, official statement, or city government website) or reported by at least two major news outlets. The policy should explicitly state the intention to restrict private vehicle access to Olympic venues, promoting the use of public transit instead. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the announced policy allows for any significant exceptions to the public transit-only rule, the question resolves as NO.

The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. question.title: Will Alibaba Group resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Alibaba Group reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Alibaba Group workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Alibaba Group and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Conditional on Alibaba Group resolving a major workers' strike, will Wisconsin hold a referendum on public school funding by July 2024?

Then, is it true that Wisconsin will hold a referendum on public school funding by July 31, 2024? This referendum must be a formal, state-wide vote on a proposed constitutional amendment or legislative measure specifically addressing public school funding, verifiable through official state government announcements or reports from at least three major, reputable news organizations. If no such referendum is held by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

The occurrence of the referendum must be verifiable through official state government announcements or reports from at least three major, reputable news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). If no such referendum is held by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, this part resolves as NO.

(3) By August 31, 2024, the United States Senate passes a bill that includes a reduction of more than 20% in the budget of the Department of Defense (Pentagon) compared to its current fiscal year's budget. The passage must be confirmed by official Senate records and reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). If no such bill is passed by the Senate by the resolution date, or if a bill is passed but the budget cut is 20% or less, this part resolves as NO.

The question resolves as YES only if all three events occur by their respective deadlines. If any of the events do not occur, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Sunny Farms be officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Sunny Farms is officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak that is different from any previously reported outbreaks. The outbreak must be traced back to products from Sunny Farms and must have occurred after October 1, 2023. If no such new outbreak is linked to Sunny Farms by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Conditional on Sunny Farms being officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak by July 2024, will the European Commission announce completion of a major tech data practices investigation by July 2024?
question.body:

The outbreak must be traced back to products from Sunny Farms and must have occurred after October 1, 2023.

question.title: Conditional on both a new salmonella outbreak linked to Sunny Farms and the completion of a major tech data practices investigation, will the Yarra River meet water quality standards for an international swimming event by August 2024?
question.body:

Given these conditions, will the Yarra River meet water quality standards for an international open water swimming event by August 31, 2024? Specifically, will official water quality tests confirm that bacteria levels in the Yarra River consistently meet the acceptable thresholds for an international open water swimming event, as defined by the event organizers and relevant health authorities, for a continuous period of at least one week during August 2024? The resolution will be based on data from official sources such as the event committee, the International Swimming Federation, or relevant Australian government agencies responsible for water quality monitoring. If the standards are not met or official tests are not conducted or made public, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Sunny Farms is officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak, (b) the European Commission announces completion of a major tech data practices investigation, and (c) the Yarra River meets water quality standards for an international open water swimming event?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if all of the following conditions are met by their respective dates: (a) By July 31, 2024, Sunny Farms is officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak that is different from any previously reported outbreaks, with the link confirmed by U.S. federal health officials (such as the CDC or FDA) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post). The outbreak must be traced back to products from Sunny Farms and must have occurred after October 1, 2023. (b) By July 31, 2024, the European Commission officially announces the completion of its investigation into tech data practices involving at least five major companies, confirmed through an official European Commission announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). (c) By August 31, 2024, official water quality tests confirm that bacteria levels in the Yarra River consistently meet the acceptable thresholds for an international open water swimming event, as defined by the event organizers and relevant health authorities. The standards must be met for a continuous period of at least one week during August 2024, to ensure suitability for multiple events. The question will resolve as NO if any of these conditions are not met by their respective dates.

question.title: Will Bloomberg Philanthropies announce a $600 million donation to historically Black medical schools by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Bloomberg Philanthropies officially announces a donation of $600 million to the endowments of four historically Black medical schools. The announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers) or through official statements from Bloomberg Philanthropies or the recipient institutions. The donation must be specifically intended for the endowments of these medical schools. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the announced amount is less than $600 million, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question is about the announcement of the donation, not its completion.

question.title: Conditional on Bloomberg Philanthropies announcing a $600 million donation to historically Black medical schools, will the Central Bank of Mexico announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Bloomberg Philanthropies officially announces a donation of $600 million to the endowments of four historically Black medical schools by August 31, 2024. Then, is it true that the Central Bank of Mexico will officially announce an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024? The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of Mexico communications, such as press releases, Governing Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. The interest rate in question refers to the target for the overnight interbank interest rate, which is the Central Bank of Mexico's primary tool for monetary policy.

Resolution criteria for the condition: The announcement of the donation must be made by the specified date and must be for at least $600 million, specifically for the endowments.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: The announcement of the interest rate cut must occur by the specified date, although the rate cut itself may take effect later. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Given both Bloomberg's $600M donation to Black medical schools and Mexico's rate cut, will Georgia hold a voting rights referendum by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following occurs by August 31, 2024: (1) Bloomberg Philanthropies officially announces a donation of $600 million to the endowments of four historically Black medical schools, confirmed by at least two reputable news sources or official statements from Bloomberg Philanthropies or the recipient institutions. The donation must be specifically intended for the endowments of these medical schools. (2) The Central Bank of Mexico officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024, confirmed by official Bank of Mexico communications.

Given the above, will Georgia hold a referendum on enshrining voting rights in its state constitution by July 31, 2024? The occurrence must be confirmed through official state announcements or coverage by at least two reputable national news organizations. The referendum must specifically address the protection of voting rights in the state constitution.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Bloomberg Philanthropies announce a $600 million donation to historically Black medical schools, (b) the Central Bank of Mexico announce an interest rate cut, and (c) Georgia hold a referendum on voting rights?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if all of the following occur by their respective dates: (1) By August 31, 2024, Bloomberg Philanthropies officially announces a donation of $600 million to the endowments of four historically Black medical schools. The announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers) or through official statements from Bloomberg Philanthropies or the recipient institutions. The donation must be specifically intended for the endowments of these medical schools. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the announced amount is less than $600 million, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question is about the announcement of the donation, not its completion. (2) By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Mexico officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of Mexico communications, such as press releases, Governing Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. question.title: Will the International Monetary Fund announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the International Monetary Fund officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official IMF channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Conditional on the IMF announcing new funding commitments over $400 million by July 2024, will Mexican authorities declare the dismantling of Los Zetas?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the International Monetary Fund officially announces new funding commitments totaling over $400 million through official channels, reported by at least two reputable news sources. These commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions, not continuations of previous commitments. 

Then, will Mexican authorities officially declare the dismantling of the Los Zetas drug cartel by July 31, 2024? This requires an official declaration by Mexican authorities, reported by at least two reputable international news outlets, stating that the cartel has been dismantled or effectively neutralized, indicating a significant disruption to their leadership, operations, or ability to function. Mere arrests or partial disruptions do not qualify. If no such declaration is made, the resolution is NO.

question.title: Conditional on the IMF announcing over $400 million in new funding and Mexico declaring Los Zetas dismantled by July 2024, will the U.S. economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, both of the following events occur:

(a) The International Monetary Fund (IMF) officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. These announcements must be made through official IMF channels and reported by at least two reputable news sources. The commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs.

(b) Mexican authorities make an official public declaration stating that the Los Zetas drug cartel has been dismantled or effectively neutralized as a criminal organization. This declaration must be reported by at least two reputable international news outlets and indicate a significant disruption to the cartel's operations.

Then, is the following true: The U.S. economy does not enter a recession by July 31, 2024, where a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis?

question.title: Will all of the following occur by July 2024: (a) the IMF announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million, (b) Mexican authorities officially declare the dismantling of the Los Zetas drug cartel, and (c) the U.S. economy avoid a recession?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, all of the following events occur:

(a) The International Monetary Fund (IMF) must officially announce one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcements must be made through official IMF channels (such as their website or press releases) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments.

(b) Mexican authorities (such as federal law enforcement agencies or high-ranking government officials) must make an official public declaration stating that the Los Zetas drug cartel has been dismantled or effectively neutralized as a criminal organization. The declaration must be reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, or major Mexican news sources). The declaration should indicate a significant disruption to the cartel's leadership structure, operations, or ability to function as a cohesive criminal entity.

(c) The U.S. economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis. The question resolves as NO if the U.S. economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

If any of the events as described do not occur by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Farm Fresh Organics be officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak by July 2024?

question.title: Conditional on Farm Fresh Organics being linked to a new salmonella outbreak, will Fresh Fields Inc. also be linked to one by July 2024?
question.body:

For Fresh Fields Inc., the same criteria apply: The link must be confirmed by U.S. federal health officials and reported by at least two reputable news sources. question.title: Given both Farm Fresh Organics and Fresh Fields Inc. are linked to new salmonella outbreaks, will the listeria outbreak death toll from smoked fish exceed 3 by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, both Farm Fresh Organics and Fresh Fields Inc. are officially linked to new salmonella outbreaks. Each outbreak is different from previously reported ones, confirmed by U.S. federal health officials, and reported by at least two reputable news sources. The outbreaks are traced back to products from Farm Fresh Organics and Fresh Fields Inc., respectively, and occurred after October 1, 2023.

Then, will the reported death toll from the listeria outbreak linked to smoked fish exceed 3 by August 31, 2024? The death toll must be confirmed by official health organizations such as the CDC or other national health authorities, or reported by at least three major reputable news sources citing official sources. The outbreak must be specifically linked to smoked fish, and deaths from other listeria outbreaks will not be considered.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Farm Fresh Organics and Fresh Fields Inc. be officially linked to new salmonella outbreaks by July 2024, and (2) the reported death toll from the listeria outbreak linked to smoked fish exceed 3 by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By July 31, 2024, both Farm Fresh Organics and Fresh Fields Inc. are officially linked to new salmonella outbreaks. Each outbreak must be different from any previously reported outbreaks, confirmed by U.S. federal health officials (such as the CDC or FDA), and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post). The outbreaks must be traced back to products from Farm Fresh Organics and Fresh Fields Inc., respectively, and must have occurred after October 1, 2023. (2) By August 31, 2024, the number of reported deaths in the listeria outbreak linked to smoked fish exceeds 3. The death toll must be confirmed by official health organizations such as the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) or other national health authorities. Alternatively, reports from at least three major reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times) citing official sources will be considered sufficient for confirmation. If either condition is not met by the respective resolution dates, the question will resolve as NO.

The donation must be specifically intended for the endowments of these schools. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Bloomberg Philanthropies announces a $600 million donation to historically Black education schools by August 2024 and the DOJ completes a major financial services investigation by July 2024, AND (2) the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate remains at or above 13.25% in August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following occur: (1) By August 31, 2024, Bloomberg Philanthropies officially announces a donation of $600 million to the endowments of historically Black education schools. The announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers) or through official statements from Bloomberg Philanthropies or the recipient institutions. The donation must be specifically intended for the endowments of these education schools. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the announced amount is less than $600 million, this component resolves as NO. (2) By July 31, 2024, the Department of Justice (DOJ) officially announces the completion of its investigation into financial services practices involving at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official DOJ announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the DOJ does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, this component resolves as NO. The first part resolves as YES only if both components resolve as YES. (3) The Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to be at or above 13.25% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 13.25% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, the second part resolves as NO. The overall question resolves as YES only if both parts resolve as YES.

question.title: Will the Saudi Royal Court announce conversion of additional vehicles to biofuel by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Saudi Royal Court officially announces that additional vehicles, beyond those already known, have been converted or are in the process of being converted to run on biofuel. The announcement must come from official channels or be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian). The additional vehicles must be part of the royal fleet or directly associated with royal transportation. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Given Saudi Royal Court announces conversion of additional vehicles to biofuel by July 2024, will a major tech company relocate its headquarters to Miami by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the Saudi Royal Court officially announces that additional vehicles, beyond those already known, have been converted or are in the process of being converted to run on biofuel. This announcement must come from official channels or be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian). The additional vehicles must be part of the royal fleet or directly associated with royal transportation.

Then, will a major tech company fully relocate its headquarters to Miami, Florida by July 31, 2024? For this to resolve as YES:
1. The relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leadership.
2. The announcement must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters must be operational in Miami, Florida, with key executive functions transferred.

Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If the move is not completed and operational by this date, or if the company decides against the move, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given both (a) Saudi biofuel vehicle conversion and (b) Miami tech headquarters relocation by July 2024, will an enforceable ethics code for U.S. Federal Court judges be established by then?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true by July 31, 2024: (a) The Saudi Royal Court officially announces that additional vehicles have been converted to biofuel, and (b) a major tech company fully relocates its headquarters to Miami, Florida, with the new headquarters operational and key executive functions transferred. Both conditions must be confirmed by at least two major, reputable news outlets.

Then, is it true that an enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Federal Court judges will be established by July 31, 2024? The code must be officially adopted by the United States government, confirmed by at least two major news outlets, legally binding, and applicable to all sitting Federal Court judges, outlining clear standards of conduct and enforcement mechanisms. Mere proposals do not qualify; the code must be formally adopted and enforceable. 

If the Saudi biofuel vehicle conversion or Miami tech headquarters relocation conditions are not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by July 2024: (a) the Saudi Royal Court announces conversion of additional vehicles to biofuel, (b) a major tech company fully relocates its headquarters to Miami, Florida, and (c) an enforceable ethics code for U.S. Federal Court judges is established?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if all of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024:

(a) The Saudi Royal Court officially announces that additional vehicles, beyond those already known, have been converted or are in the process of being converted to run on biofuel. The announcement must come from official channels or be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian). The additional vehicles must be part of the royal fleet or directly associated with royal transportation.

(b) A major tech company has fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Miami, Florida. For the resolution to be affirmative, the relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leadership, and reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The new headquarters must be operational in Miami, Florida, with key executive functions transferred. Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will not be sufficient for a YES resolution.

(c) An enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Federal Court judges is officially adopted by the United States government. The adoption must be confirmed by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting Federal Court judges. It should outline clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement. If no such code meeting these criteria is established and officially adopted by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

If all three of these conditions are met, the question will resolve as YES. If any of these conditions are not met, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Fisker receive over $500 million in grants for electric vehicle initiatives by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Fisker is confirmed to have received more than $500 million in grants from the U.S. federal government for electric vehicle-related initiatives. These initiatives may include manufacturing, assembly, or other aspects of electric vehicle production. The confirmation must come from official government announcements, Fisker's official statements, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The grants must be specifically allocated for electric vehicle-related projects and not for general automotive purposes. If no such confirmation is made by the specified date, or if the confirmed amount is $500 million or less, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given Fisker receives over $500 million in grants for electric vehicle initiatives by July 2024, will the Central Bank of Russia announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, Fisker is confirmed to have received more than $500 million in grants from the U.S. federal government for electric vehicle-related initiatives. These initiatives may include manufacturing, assembly, or other aspects of electric vehicle production. The confirmation must come from official government announcements, Fisker's official statements, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). Then, will the Central Bank of Russia publicly announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024? The announcement must be officially made by the Central Bank of Russia and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the key rate, which is the Central Bank of Russia's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction.

question.title: Conditional on Fisker receiving over $500 million in grants for electric vehicle initiatives by July 2024 and the Central Bank of Russia announcing a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024, will Swiss banking employees remain on strike through August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, Fisker receives more than $500 million in grants from the U.S. federal government specifically for electric vehicle-related initiatives, confirmed by official government announcements, Fisker's official statements, or reports from at least three major news organizations. Additionally, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Russia publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate, reported by at least two reputable financial news sources. Resolution criteria: Resolves YES if, by August 31, 2024, banking employees in Switzerland are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from the banks, the unions representing the workers, or the Swiss government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources. If the employees have fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Fisker receives over $500 million in grants for electric vehicle initiatives by July 2024 and the Central Bank of Russia announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024, (2) Swiss banking employees remain on strike through August 2024?

Additionally, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Russia publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate, with the announcement reported by at least two reputable financial news sources. (2) By August 31, 2024, banking employees in Switzerland are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from the banks, the unions representing the workers, or the Swiss government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Swissinfo, Neue Zürcher Zeitung, or Reuters). Both conditions in (1) and the condition in (2) must be met for the question to resolve as YES; if any condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the ICC officially announce plans to use AI for umpire decision reviews by July 2024?

question.title: Will all of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Amazon announce additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 5% (b) Rogers Communications publicly confirm a payment to a hacker to erase sensitive data (c) Italy's Senate pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Meloni?
